Detailed Description

Subclass of packet that is superclass of all ReplyPackets.

The header in class Packet is extended with one field that contains the status of the reply.

Format of ReplyPacket subheader:
PosSizeComment
HEADER_SIZE 4 bytes Status of this reply.

Definition at line 1432 of file Packet.h.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

ReplyPacket::ReplyPacket (   ) 
 

Creates an empty ReplyPacket.

The internal buffer is created with MAX_PACKET_SIZE bytes.

See also:
getStatus

ReplyPacket::ReplyPacket (  byte *  buf,
uint32  bufLength
) 
 

Create a ReplyPacket and fill it with a given buffer.

Parameters:
buf The preallocated buffer. This must be alligned (created like buf = (byte*) new uint32[x]).
bufLength The length of the byte-buffer.

Creates a ReplyPacket with the needed parameters.

See also:
getStatus
Parameters:
bufLength The length of the internal buffer.
subType Type of the packet, from the list in Packet.
req The corresponding request of this reply. Used to set the common fields in the header.
status The status of this request.

Member Function Documentation

bool ReplyPacket::checkStatus (  const char *  sender  ) 
 

Checks the status of the packet and prints the error if != OK.

Parameters:
sender A string describing the position or state of the program. Used for printing to the screen.
Returns:
true if status was OK. false otherwise.

uint32 ReplyPacket::getStatus (   )  const [inline]
 

Get the status of this reply.

The status is in terms of stringcodes in class StringTable. The ``OK-string'' (StringTable::OK) is used to indicate that the reply is calculated alright.

Returns:
Status of this reply.
